alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Marshall (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued February 27 at 12:51PM EST until February 27 at 1:15PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN FULTON AND SOUTHEASTERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 1251 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles northwest of Rochester, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Fulton and southeastern Marshall Counties, including the following locations... Walnut, Tiosa and Talma. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN <50 MPH
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
